```java
public void save(View view) {
    myImage.setDrawingCacheEnabled(true);
    Bitmap imgV = myImage.getDrawingCache();
    String root = Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory().toString();
    File myDir = new File(root + "/AVP_saved");
    if (!myDir.exists()) {
        myDir.mkdirs();
    }
    String fname = "Image.png";
    File file = new File(myDir, fname);
    try {
        FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(file);
        imgV.compress(Bitmap.CompressFormat.PNG, 90, out);
        out.flush();
        out.close();
        Toast.makeText(this, "Image Downloaded", 7000).show();
    } catch (Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
        Toast.makeText(this, e.getMessage(), 8000).show();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, you can use the `mkdirs()` method from the `File` class to create the directory if it doesn't exist. Before creating the file, you can check if the directory exists using the `exists()` method. If it doesn't exist, you can call `mkdirs()` to create the directory and its parent directories if necessary. This will ensure that the folder "AVP_saved" is created before saving the image.
